external_references.description: Saini, A. and Hossein, J. (2022, January 27). North Korea’s Lazarus APT leverages Windows Update client, GitHub in latest campaign. Retrieved January 27, 2022.
Pradhan, A. (2022, February 8). LolZarus: Lazarus Group Incorporating Lolbins into Campaigns. Retrieved March 22, 2022.

description: [Lazarus Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0032) has changed memory protection permissions then overwritten in memory DLL function code with shellcode, which was later executed via [KernelCallbackTable](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1574/013) hijacking. [Lazarus Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0032) has also used shellcode within macros to decrypt and manually map DLLs into memory at runtime.(Citation: Lazarus APT January 2022)(Citation: Qualys LolZarus)
